alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 6:55PM MST until August 14 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Havasu Creek basin in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * At 652 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Havasu Creek basin, extending eastward 15 to 20 miles to the Colorado River in Grand Canyon National Park. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen in the Havasu Creek basin, with 1 to 2 inches farther east over the Grand Canyon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Havasu Creek basin, as well as over the Grand Canyon north and east of Supai. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Havasu Creek basin. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Supai and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Colorado River, Little Coyote Canyon, Hundred and Twenty Mile Creek, Hundred and Twentyseven Mile Creek, Havasu Creek, Shinumo Creek, Tapeats Creek, Deer Creek and Hundred and Twentyeight Mile Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Havasu Creek basin. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving.
